Detailed Description

Represents a file and allows for easy manipulation of the filesystem.

Todo:
Should open happen automatically upon construction like fstream?
Todo:
This class is just started. It works for now, but will need work later on.
Todo:
Add zipfile support
Todo:
Support for '\'??
Todo:
Look at making a super class for this to share functionality with sockets. I believe I would pull out things like open, close, atEnd, etc... At that point I may consider having a ReadStream and a WriteStream, but then I have to start asking where the common file functionaliy goes. Multiple inheritance or interfaces would be my only real choices then (I like neither). |--> ReadStream --| As another though, I could have stream Stream--| |--> File |--> WriteStream --| This would be MUCH more like std's way of doing it. Note the need for virtual inheritence though...
Todo:
Move delete impl to FileSystem.
Todo:
Add move and copy functions, making use of FileSystem.
Author:
Brent Wilson
Date:
4/22/07

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum File::OffsetBase

Used when setting the stream pointer position in subclasses.

Enumerator:
Current  Offset from the current position.
Beginning  Offset from the start of the stream.
End  Offset from the end of the stream.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

File::File ( const string &  dir,
const string &  file,
std::ios_base::openmode  openMode,
bool  openNow 
) [protected]

Creates a file with the given path and open mode (in/out, binary/ascii).

Parameters:
dir The directory of the file to open.
file The name of the file to open.
openMode The ios mode to use while opening the file.
openNow If true, the file will call open() in the constructor.

File::~File (  )  [virtual]

Basic file destructor.

Member Function Documentation

bool File::open (  ) 

Opens the file for read/write operations.

Returns:
True if the file was opened successfully, false otherwise.

void File::close (  ) 

Closes the file.

bool File::atEnd (  ) 

Reports if the stream has reached the end of the file.

Returns:
True if we are at the end of the file

bool File::exists (  ) 

Checks to see if the file exists on the file system. Generally the only time this will be the case is when a WriteFile has been created, but not opened yet. A ReadFile MUST point at something that exists.

Returns:
True is the file exists, false otherwise.

bool File::isOpen (  ) 

Checks to see if the file is open at the moment.

Returns:
True if the file is open, false otherwise.

bool File::seek ( long long  offset,
OffsetBase  base = Beginning 
)

Sets the current read/write position based on the offset and base.

Parameters:
offset The offset to seek to, depends on the base.
base The point to offset from.
Returns:
True if no error occured, false otherwise.

long long File::position (  ) 

Returns the current read/write position of the stream.

Returns:
the position of the stream.

bool File::deleteFile (  ) 

Attempts to delete a file from the file system. To do this, the file must be closed (by EVERYTHING, not just this object) and the user must have the correct permissions.

Returns:
True if the file was deleted, false otherwise.

long long File::length (  ) 

Returns the length of the file in bytes.

Returns:
The length of the file in bytes.

const string & File::fullName (  ) 

Returns the full path of the file (directory and filename).

Returns:
The full path of the file.

const string & File::fileName (  ) 

Returns the name of the file (no directory).

Returns:
The name of the file.

const string & File::dirName (  ) 

Returns the name of the directory of the file.

Returns:
The directory name.
